snippet: The city government of Volgograd voted to officially restore its onetime Communist-era name, Stalingrad, for six days each year.
abstract: City government of Volgograd, Russia, votes unanimously to restore its onetime Communist-era name of Stalingrad for six days each year, on anniversary of landmark victory there over Nazis in 1943 and on five other days commemorating Soviet Union's victory in war; decision comes amid wave of state-sponsored patriotism and nostalgia for Soviet Union in Russia and even for Joseph Stalin himself.
lead_paragraph: The city government of Volgograd voted to officially restore its onetime Communist-era name, Stalingrad, for six days each year.

headline.seo: Volgograd Named Stalingrad Again, at Least Sometimes
headline.main: Russia Revives the Namesake of ‘Uncle Joe’
headline.print_headline: Russia Revives The Namesake Of ‘Uncle Joe’
